32.heading: Families.
32.title: Marmalade Boy
32.author: by Wataru Yoshizumi.
notes: Summary: "All Miki Koishikawa wanted was an ordinary family, and that's exactly what she had. Then one fateful day her parents met the Matsuuras, and turned Miki's world upside-down. Now she lives in a house with four parents and her new stepbrother, Yuu, who is a total jerk. Make that a totally cute jerk. It's bad enough being brought into her parents' strange soap opera, but Miki will star in a soap of her own when she ends up torn between her long-time crush, Ginta, and her new stepbrother."

38.heading: Families.
38.title: Motherless Child
38.author: artist and writer, Thom Scott III.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 26 cm.

"Motherless Child tells the story of Kenny, a man who has no feeling for what his life is about, and finds what shelter he can in his family. An ex-Marine, a sentimentalist, a cynic, Kenny is subject to fits of laughter and rage. As his mother and father age, Kenny faces a crisis..."

78.heading: Families.
78.title: "Special Agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation". 5 p. True Comics, no. 39
78.author: [No author]
notes: (7th story; pages 26-30 of magazine; mentioned on cover)

SUMMARY: FBI Agent Steve Saunders goes to Arkansas, and his first case is bringing in a draft dodger, farmer Hurbie Rains. A battle with guns, shovels and axes ends with Hurbie wounded and the whole family in court. No motive for Hurbie's actions is given. 1. United States. Federal Bureau of Investigation. k. FBI agents. k. Arkansas. k. Draft dodgers. k. Farmers. k. Guns. k. Shovels. k. Axes. k. Family. k. Court. k. Motives. Call no.: PN6728.1.P3T7no.39

141.heading: La Famille de Nohey--Miscellanea.
141.title: "Yataca : Fils de la Couleur"
141.author: Dominik Vallet
141.appears_in: text p. 69-79 in Cap'tain Swing, no. 113 (Août 2003).
notes: Describes the periodical Yataca, which started as a medium-sized color comic in 1968, then after 20 issues became a small-format black and white. It lasted 254 issues and until 1989. After a biographical sketch of artist Denis McLoughlin (1918-2002) the major series of the periodical are separately described: Yataca (a South American jungle adventure), Les Diables de Paxton, Marney le Renard, Marsimonstre, Antares, La Famille de Nohey, Chuck Batson, Dave Wheeler, Goal Keeper, Kangourou Kid, Les Cybernétiques, Roy et ses Diables, Mizomba, Ricky, Ron Camaro, & Ron Flash. Minor series are listed, and all features have issue numbers and credits.
